positions.title: Product Architect
description: I started as a UI5 developer for implementing a GxP digital solution for handling certificates.

Quickly advanced to a senior role, leading UI5 and CAP applications and with a constant self-improvement mindset, I managed to grasp Novo Nordisk’s complex systems such as LIMS and VaultRIM with ease. I was developing end-to-end applications on SAP BTP, while also designing, articulating, and implementing architectural patterns across complex on-prem system integrations.
I was later appointed Product Architect with responsibilies around people, process, and technology ensuring quality across the product lifecycle.

positions.title: Full-stack software developer
description: Full-stack software developer working across the entire development lifecycle—from SQL database design and backend logic in .NET/C# to building dynamic front-end interfaces using Angular and TypeScript. I also applied HTML and CSS to craft responsive, user-friendly designs.
As part of a Scrum team practicing Agile methodology, I’ve contributed to some of the most critical features in the company’s core PIM solution, driving both functionality and visual improvements.

positions.title: Software developer
description: I was a member of a Scrum team that implemented from the ground up a comprehensive software solution for antimicrobial stewardship.

During my time at Treat Systems, I worked with antimicrobial stewardship data collection and manipulation, within an environment where requirements precision and error toleration were extremely strict.

positions.title: Software developer
description: I worked on two major projects:
Network Operation Center Email Collector (NOC): An application that collects data from mobile operators, stores it and displays it in responsive graphs, to detect data anomalies or misbehavior.

Manual and Automated Testing Strategy:  A fully documented test strategy for the above-mentioned application(NOC), and the company main product 'OSS Suite 2solve', which included unit tests, integration tests and automated GUI tests.

The projects were highly complex, involving multiple third-party systems and APIs, and required a deep understanding of networking concepts and protocols. I worked with technologies such as Java, Spring Boot and various testing frameworks.

positions.title: Software developer
description: I worked on a social-betting platform for casual and dedicated bettors, where I implemented social and betting features, using .NET/C# and SQL Server as backend technologies, and Angular and TypeScript for the front-end.
